uniqueRequirements: Level 1 License requires Segment 1 Driver Ed.
Kelsey's Law prohibits mobile phone use for Level 1 & 2 drivers.
Move Over Law includes utility and maintenance vehicles.
Zero Tolerance for BAC > 0.02% for under 21.

questions.questionText: Under Kelsey's Law, drivers with a Level 1 or Level 2 Graduated Driver License are prohibited from:

answers.text: Using a mobile phone while driving

questions.explanation: Kelsey's Law prohibits drivers with a Level 1 or Level 2 license from using a cell phone while driving, even if hands-free.

questions.questionText: Michigan's Basic Speed Law means:

answers.text: You must drive at a careful and prudent speed for conditions, regardless of the posted limit
Drive at least the posted limit

questions.explanation: The Basic Speed Law states you must drive at a careful and prudent speed in all driving conditions, which may be lower than the posted limit.

questions.questionText: When passing a stationary emergency, utility, or waste service vehicle with flashing lights, you must:

answers.text: Slow down to 10 mph below the speed limit and move over one lane if possible

questions.explanation: Michigan's Move Over Law requires slowing down to 10 mph below the posted limit and moving over if safe.

questions.questionText: A Level 2 License holder may not drive between the hours of:
questions.explanation: Level 2 drivers cannot drive between 10 PM and 5 AM unless for work or accompanied by a parent/guardian.

questions.questionText: It is illegal to have a BAC of ___ or higher if you are under 21 (Zero Tolerance).
questions.explanation: Under Zero Tolerance, it is illegal for anyone under 21 to drive with a BAC of 0.02% or higher.

questions.questionText: To avoid a collision with a deer:
questions.explanation: If a deer collision is unavoidable, do not swerve. Swerving often leads to more severe crashes. Brake firmly and hold the wheel straight.

questions.questionText: A yellow 5-sided sign shaped like an old schoolhouse means:
questions.explanation: The pentagon sign marks a school zone or school crossing.

questions.questionText: A diamond-shaped sign with orange background indicates:
questions.explanation: Orange diamond signs warn of construction zones.

questions.questionText: When driving in fog, you should use:
questions.explanation: Always use low beams in fog. High beams reflect back and reduce visibility.

questions.questionText: Unless otherwise posted, the speed limit in mobile home parks and on some municipal streets is:
questions.explanation: The speed limit in mobile home parks is generally 15 mph.

questions.questionText: At an uncontrolled intersection, you must yield to:
questions.explanation: Yield to the vehicle on your right at uncontrolled intersections.

questions.questionText: You cannot park within ___ feet of a fire hydrant.
questions.explanation: Parking within 15 feet of a fire hydrant is illegal in Michigan.

questions.questionText: A yellow pennant-shaped sign on the left side of the road means:
questions.explanation: The pennant shape marks the start of a No Passing Zone.

questions.questionText: A round yellow sign with an X and RR means:
questions.explanation: This is the advance warning sign for a railroad crossing.

questions.questionText: If you are involved in a crash involving injury or death, you must:
questions.explanation: You must stop immediately at the scene, help the injured, and report to police.

questions.questionText: If your vehicle skids:

answers.text: Take your foot off the accelerator and turn in the direction the rear of the vehicle is sliding

questions.explanation: Steer in the direction of the skid (where the rear is going).

questions.questionText: When passing a cyclist, you must allow at least ___ space.
questions.explanation: Drivers passing a bicycle must leave at least 3 feet of space.

questions.questionText: Green signs indicate:
questions.explanation: Green signs are guide signs.

questions.questionText: Unless posted otherwise, the speed limit in business and residential areas is:
questions.explanation: The default speed limit for business and residential areas is 25 mph.

questions.questionText: A yellow diamond sign with a truck on a slope means:
questions.explanation: This sign warns of a steep downgrade.

questions.questionText: You must use headlights when visibility is reduced to:
questions.explanation: Headlights are required when visibility is 500 feet or less.

questions.questionText: If you are tired while driving:
questions.explanation: The only safe cure for fatigue is rest.

questions.questionText: A flashing red light means:
questions.explanation: Treat a flashing red light as a stop sign.

questions.questionText: A flashing yellow light means:
questions.explanation: Flashing yellow means slow down and proceed with caution.

questions.questionText: You must stop for a school bus with flashing red lights:
questions.explanation: You must stop at least 20 feet from a bus with flashing red lights.

questions.questionText: Large trucks have blind spots called:
questions.explanation: Blind spots around trucks are called No-Zones.

questions.questionText: Following distance on the highway should be:
questions.explanation: Michigan recommends a 3-4 second following distance.

questions.questionText: When turning left at an intersection:
questions.explanation: Left turning vehicles must yield to oncoming traffic.

questions.questionText: Brown signs indicate:
questions.explanation: Brown signs point to parks and recreation areas.

questions.questionText: It is illegal to park within ___ feet of a crosswalk.
questions.explanation: Parking within 20 feet of a marked crosswalk is prohibited.

questions.questionText: You may turn right on red:
questions.explanation: Right on red is legal after stopping, unless signs say otherwise.

questions.questionText: In a roundabout, traffic moves:
questions.explanation: Traffic in a roundabout always moves counter-clockwise.

questions.questionText: A yellow sign with a cross (+) means:
questions.explanation: The cross symbol warns of an intersection.

questions.questionText: If an emergency vehicle is approaching:

answers.text: Pull to the right edge and stop

questions.explanation: Yield to emergency vehicles by pulling to the right and stopping.

questions.questionText: Unless posted, the speed limit on highways is:
questions.explanation: On unposted highways, the limit is generally 55 mph.

questions.questionText: Before changing lanes, you should:
questions.explanation: Always check mirrors and turn your head to check blind spots.

questions.questionText: A solid yellow line on your side means:
questions.explanation: Solid yellow on your side prohibits passing.

questions.questionText: A red triangle pointing down means:
questions.explanation: Inverted red triangle is Yield.

questions.questionText: It is illegal to use high beams within ___ feet of an oncoming vehicle.
questions.explanation: Dim high beams 500 feet before meeting a vehicle.

questions.questionText: When merging onto a freeway:
questions.explanation: Use the ramp to match highway speed.

questions.questionText: You must yield to a pedestrian using a white cane:
questions.explanation: Blind pedestrians with canes have absolute right of way.

questions.questionText: On wet roads, you should:

answers.text: Slow down and increase following distance

questions.explanation: Reduce speed on wet roads to prevent hydroplaning.

questions.questionText: Blue signs indicate:
questions.explanation: Blue is used for motorist services.

questions.questionText: If you miss your exit on the freeway:
questions.explanation: Never back up on a freeway. Proceed to next exit.

questions.questionText: Seat belts are required for:

answers.text: All passengers in the front seat and all passengers under 16 anywhere

questions.explanation: Michigan law requires seat belts for driver/front passengers and anyone under 16.

questions.questionText: A rectangular sign with white background means:
questions.explanation: White rectangles are regulatory signs.

questions.questionText: If the rear of your car skids right:

answers.text: Turn the wheel to the right

questions.explanation: Steer in the direction of the skid.

questions.questionText: Children under age ___ must be in a car seat/booster.
questions.explanation: Children under 8 or under 4'9" must use a booster/seat.

questions.questionText: The speed limit in construction zones is usually:
questions.explanation: Construction zones are often posted at 45 mph where workers are present.

questions.questionText: When a traffic light turns green:
questions.explanation: Do not go immediately; check that the intersection is clear first.

questions.questionText: A regulatory sign is usually what shape?
questions.explanation: Regulatory signs, such as speed limit signs, are typically vertical rectangles with black text on a white background.

questions.questionText: What is the meaning of a flashing yellow arrow signal?

answers.text: Protected turn; you have the right of way
Stop and wait for a green arrow
Turns are allowed, but you must yield to oncoming traffic and pedestrians

questions.explanation: A flashing yellow arrow allows you to turn left when safe, but you must yield to oncoming traffic and pedestrians.

questions.questionText: A sign with a yellow background and black lettering indicates:
questions.explanation: Yellow signs with black lettering are warning signs that alert drivers to potential hazards ahead.

questions.questionText: A 'Slow Moving Vehicle' emblem is:

answers.text: A triangular orange sign with a red reflective border

questions.explanation: The Slow Moving Vehicle emblem is a reflective orange triangle with a red border, displayed on vehicles traveling 25 mph or less.

questions.questionText: What does a sign with a chevron (arrow) pointing to the left indicate?

answers.text: Sharp curve or change in road direction to the left

questions.explanation: Chevron signs emphasize the curvature of the road and mark the edge of a sharp curve.

questions.questionText: Under Michigan's 'Super Drunk' law, enhanced penalties apply for a BAC of ___ or higher.
questions.explanation: Drivers with a BAC of 0.17% or higher face 'Super Drunk' charges, which include stiffer penalties like mandatory alcohol treatment and longer license suspensions.

questions.questionText: You must use your headlights when there is not enough light to see clearly at a distance of:
questions.explanation: Headlights must be used when visibility is reduced to 500 feet or less.

questions.questionText: Refusing a chemical test under the Implied Consent Law results in an automatic license suspension for:
questions.explanation: A first refusal to take a chemical test results in an automatic one-year license suspension and 6 points on your record.

questions.questionText: When a school bus is stopped with its yellow overhead lights flashing, you should:
questions.explanation: Flashing yellow lights on a school bus mean it is about to stop. You should prepare to stop.

questions.questionText: Drivers with a Level 2 Graduated License are generally prohibited from driving between:
questions.explanation: Level 2 drivers cannot drive between 10 PM and 5 AM unless accompanied by a parent/guardian or driving for work/authorized activity.

questions.questionText: When driving in rain, you should:

answers.text: Drive in the tracks of the vehicle ahead

questions.explanation: Driving in the tracks of the vehicle ahead can improve traction. Never use cruise control on wet roads.

questions.questionText: If your accelerator sticks, you should:

answers.text: Shift to Neutral and apply steady brake pressure

questions.explanation: Shift to Neutral to disengage the engine power, apply the brakes, and steer to a safe stop.

questions.questionText: You cannot park within ___ feet of a stop sign or traffic signal.
questions.explanation: Michigan law prohibits parking within 30 feet of a flashing beacon, stop sign, or traffic control signal.

questions.questionText: Parking is prohibited within ___ feet of a railroad crossing.
questions.explanation: You must not park within 50 feet of the nearest rail of a railroad crossing.

questions.questionText: When entering a roundabout, you must yield to:

answers.text: No one, merge like a highway

questions.explanation: Yield to traffic already circulating in the roundabout and pedestrians.

questions.questionText: How many points are placed on your record for 'Reckless Driving'?
questions.explanation: Reckless driving is a 6-point violation in Michigan.

questions.questionText: Speeding in a designated work zone when workers are present results in:
questions.explanation: Fines are doubled for speeding violations in work zones when workers are present.

questions.questionText: A sign shaped like a crossbuck (X) indicates:
questions.explanation: The crossbuck sign marks a railroad crossing.

questions.questionText: What does a sign with a red circle and a slash over a symbol mean?
questions.explanation: A red circle with a slash indicates that the action shown is prohibited (e.g., No U-Turn).

questions.questionText: When turning, you must activate your turn signal at least ___ feet before the turn.
questions.explanation: Michigan law requires signaling your turn at least 100 feet in advance.

questions.questionText: Drivers under 18 are prohibited from using a cell phone to:

answers.text: Make a call or text while driving

questions.explanation: Kelsey's Law bans cell phone use for drivers with Level 1 or 2 licenses, except for emergencies.

questions.questionText: The area around a large truck where the driver cannot see you is known as the:
questions.explanation: The No-Zone includes blind spots on the sides, rear, and front of a large commercial truck.

questions.questionText: At a 4-way stop, if two vehicles arrive at the same time:

answers.text: The vehicle on the left has the right of way
The vehicle on the right has the right of way

questions.explanation: At a 4-way stop, yield to the vehicle on your right if you arrive simultaneously.

questions.questionText: Driving 16 mph or more over the speed limit results in ___ points on your license.
questions.explanation: Speeding 16 mph or more over the posted limit adds 4 points to your driving record.

questions.questionText: Drag racing is a ___ point violation.
questions.explanation: Drag racing carries a penalty of 4 points on your driving record.

questions.questionText: A sign displaying a person in a wheelchair indicates:
questions.explanation: This symbol marks spaces reserved for vehicles with a disability placard or license plate.

questions.questionText: When you see a funeral procession:

answers.text: You may cut through it if you have a green light
You must yield the right of way to all vehicles in the procession

questions.explanation: Do not cut through a funeral procession. They have the right of way.

questions.questionText: Hydroplaning can occur at speeds as low as:
questions.explanation: In heavy rain, hydroplaning (tires losing contact with the road) can start at speeds as low as 35 mph.

questions.questionText: If an oncoming driver fails to dim their high beams, you should:

answers.text: Look toward the right edge of the road

questions.explanation: Look to the right edge of your lane to avoid being blinded by the glare.

questions.questionText: To make a 'Michigan Left', you must:

answers.text: Turn left at the light directly
Drive past the intersection, turn left into a median crossover, then turn right
Turn right, then make a U-turn at a median crossover

questions.explanation: A Michigan Left involves turning right onto the road and then making a U-turn at a designated median crossover.

questions.questionText: It is illegal to leave a child younger than ___ unattended in a vehicle.
questions.explanation: Michigan law prohibits leaving a child under 6 unattended in a vehicle if it puts them at risk.

questions.questionText: A two-way traffic sign is:

answers.text: A yellow diamond with two arrows pointing in opposite directions

questions.explanation: The two-way traffic warning sign uses two arrows pointing up and down.

questions.questionText: When turning left on a solid green light:

answers.text: You have the right of way
You must yield to oncoming traffic

questions.explanation: A solid green light means turn when safe; you must yield to oncoming traffic.

questions.questionText: Careless driving adds ___ points to your record.
questions.explanation: Careless driving is a 3-point civil infraction.

questions.questionText: The safest way to stop on ice is to:

answers.text: Apply gentle, steady pressure (with ABS) or pump brakes (without ABS)

questions.explanation: Apply steady pressure if you have ABS. If not, pump the brakes gently.

questions.questionText: Parking in a handicap space without a placard is:

answers.text: Illegal and subject to a fine
Allowed if you stay in the car

questions.explanation: It is illegal to park in a handicap zone without a valid permit.

questions.questionText: A sign with a curved arrow and the word 'Only' means:

answers.text: You must turn in the direction of the arrow

questions.explanation: Lane use control signs marked 'Only' require you to turn in the indicated direction.

questions.questionText: When a traffic signal is not working (blacked out), you should:
questions.explanation: A malfunctioning traffic signal must be treated as a 4-way stop intersection.

questions.questionText: How many points are assessed for 'Open Intoxicants in a Motor Vehicle'?
questions.explanation: Having an open container of alcohol in the vehicle is a 2-point violation.

questions.questionText: When entering a freeway, who has the right of way?
questions.explanation: Freeway traffic has the right of way. Merging drivers must yield.

questions.questionText: An orange sign with 'End Road Work' indicates:

answers.text: The construction zone is over; resume normal speed limit

questions.explanation: This sign marks the end of the work zone and its specific restrictions.

questions.questionText: For a Level 3 License, you must be crash and violation free for ___ consecutive months.
questions.explanation: You must drive for 12 consecutive months without a crash or violation to qualify for a Level 3 license.

questions.questionText: Before backing up, you should:

answers.text: Check your mirrors and look over your shoulder
Rely on the backup camera only

questions.explanation: Always physically look over your shoulder to check blind spots before backing.

questions.questionText: When parking downhill with a curb, turn your wheels:
questions.explanation: Turn wheels toward the curb so if the car rolls, it hits the curb.

questions.questionText: Refusing a Preliminary Breath Test (PBT) if you are under 21 adds ___ points.
questions.explanation: Refusal of a PBT by a driver under 21 is a 2-point violation.

questions.questionText: A yellow sign with a deer symbol means:
questions.explanation: This sign warns that deer frequently cross the road in this area.

questions.questionText: If you approach an intersection with a yield sign:

answers.text: Slow down and give right of way to traffic

questions.explanation: Yield means slow down and stop if necessary to let other traffic pass.

questions.questionText: When driving at night, you should be able to stop:

answers.text: Within the distance you can see with your headlights

questions.explanation: Never drive faster than your headlights allow you to see clearly ahead.

questions.questionText: Pedestrians in a crosswalk:

answers.text: Always have the right of way

questions.explanation: Drivers must yield to pedestrians in marked or unmarked crosswalks.

questions.questionText: It is illegal to use a radar detector in:
questions.explanation: Radar detectors are prohibited in commercial vehicles in Michigan.

questions.questionText: A sign with a bicycle symbol indicates:
questions.explanation: This sign warns of bicycle traffic or marks a designated bike route.

questions.questionText: How many points for failing to stop for a school bus?
questions.explanation: Failing to stop for a school bus is a 3-point violation.

questions.questionText: To recover from a skid, you should:

answers.text: Steer into the skid (direction rear is going)

questions.explanation: Steering in the direction the rear is sliding helps realign the vehicle.

questions.questionText: A pentagon-shaped sign means:
questions.explanation: The pentagon (5-sided) shape is reserved for school signs.

questions.questionText: If a police officer signals you to stop at an intersection with a green light:
questions.explanation: Instructions from a police officer always override traffic signals and signs.

questions.questionText: You may not park within ___ feet of a driveway.
questions.explanation: Do not block a driveway. Generally, avoid parking within 5 feet of a driveway curb cut.

questions.questionText: Driving with an expired license is a:
questions.explanation: Driving without a valid license is a misdemeanor.

questions.questionText: An upside-down triangle sign is always a:
questions.explanation: The yield sign is the only 3-sided sign pointing downward.

questions.questionText: When sharing the road with a motorcycle:

answers.text: Give them the full lane width

questions.explanation: Motorcycles are entitled to the full width of the lane.

questions.questionText: You are required to yield to a public transit bus:

answers.text: When it is signaling to re-enter traffic

questions.explanation: You must yield to a bus that has signaled and is re-entering traffic from a stop.

questions.questionText: Electronic highway message boards provide:
questions.explanation: Dynamic message signs warn of traffic delays, accidents, or weather.

questions.questionText: When driving a vehicle with an airbag, you should sit at least ___ inches from the steering wheel.
questions.explanation: Maintain at least 10 inches between your chest and the steering wheel.

questions.questionText: If two vehicles approach an unregulated T-intersection:

answers.text: The driver on the terminating road must yield
The driver on the through road must yield
The driver on the left goes

questions.explanation: Traffic on the terminating road (the stem of the T) must yield to through traffic.

questions.questionText: When a truck driver is turning right, they often:

answers.text: Swing wide to the left first

questions.explanation: Trucks make wide turns; do not try to pass them on the right.

questions.questionText: A 16-year-old driver with a Level 2 license who accumulates ___ points in 12 months may be re-examined.
questions.explanation: Any driver who accumulates 12 points may be called for re-examination.

questions.questionText: A 'Do Not Pass' sign is:
questions.explanation: The 'Do Not Pass' regulatory sign is a white rectangle. The warning pennant marks the zone.

questions.questionText: The legal limit for tread depth on tires is:
questions.explanation: Tires must have at least 2/32 inch of tread.

questions.questionText: If you experience brake failure:
questions.explanation: Pump the brakes to build pressure. If that fails, use the parking brake.

questions.questionText: When you see a 'Yield' sign:

answers.text: Slow down and be ready to stop

questions.explanation: Yield means give way; stop if traffic is present.

questions.questionText: Operating While Visibly Impaired (OWVI) adds ___ points to your license.
questions.explanation: OWVI is a 4-point offense.

questions.questionText: Route markers (shields) are used to:
questions.explanation: Shield-shaped signs identify Interstate, U.S., and State routes.

questions.questionText: The best way to handle a curve is to:

answers.text: Slow down before entering the curve

questions.explanation: Slow down before the curve to maintain control.

questions.questionText: You may pass on the right when:

answers.text: The vehicle ahead is turning left and there is a paved lane

questions.explanation: You can pass on the right if there is a lane and the vehicle is turning left. Never use the shoulder.

questions.questionText: When parallel parking, you should be within ___ of the curb.
questions.explanation: Michigan law requires parking within 12 inches of the curb.

questions.questionText: Speeding 11 to 15 mph over the limit is a ___ point violation.
questions.explanation: Speeding 11-15 mph over is 3 points.

questions.questionText: A sign that says 'Soft Shoulder' means:

answers.text: Do not drive off the pavement

questions.explanation: Soft shoulder means the dirt on the side of the road is soft and dangerous.

questions.questionText: When towing a trailer, you must:
questions.explanation: Towing increases stopping distance, so increase following distance.

questions.questionText: If a tire blows out:

answers.text: Grip the wheel firmly and slow down gradually

questions.explanation: Do not brake hard. Grip the wheel to maintain control.

questions.questionText: You must yield to oncoming traffic when:
questions.explanation: Left turns yield to oncoming traffic unless there is a green arrow.

questions.questionText: A broken yellow line next to a solid yellow line means:

answers.text: Passing is allowed from the broken side

questions.explanation: You may pass if the broken line is on your side.

questions.questionText: A T-intersection warning sign is:

answers.text: Yellow diamond with a T shape

questions.explanation: The T symbol warns that the road ends ahead.

questions.questionText: The 'Move Over Law' applies to:

answers.text: Emergency, utility, and road service vehicles with flashing lights

questions.explanation: The law covers all emergency, utility, and maintenance vehicles with flashing lights.

questions.questionText: Aggressive driving includes:
questions.explanation: Tailgating, speeding, and erratic lane changes are signs of aggressive driving.

questions.questionText: You must stop for a crossing guard:

answers.text: At all times when they are holding a stop sign

questions.explanation: You must obey the directions of a crossing guard holding a stop sign.

questions.questionText: Driving 10 mph or less over the speed limit results in ___ points.
questions.explanation: Speeding 10 mph or less over the limit is a 2-point violation.

questions.questionText: A sign showing a truck with a red circle and slash means:
questions.explanation: The red slash prohibits trucks on that road.

questions.questionText: To avoid glare from headlights behind you:
questions.explanation: Flip the rearview mirror tab to the night setting.

questions.questionText: You are approaching a railroad crossing with no signals. You should:

answers.text: Slow down, listen, and look both ways

questions.explanation: Always slow down and look for trains at uncontrolled crossings.

questions.questionText: When parallel parking between two cars, you have the right of way to:
questions.explanation: You must signal and reverse into the spot; traffic behind should wait.

questions.questionText: The speed limit in a school zone is usually:
questions.explanation: School zones are typically 25 mph unless posted lower during school hours.

questions.questionText: A yellow sign with a winding arrow means:
questions.explanation: The winding arrow warns of a series of curves.

questions.questionText: Texting while driving is a:
questions.explanation: Texting while driving is a civil infraction for all drivers.

questions.questionText: When driving near a motorcycle, increase your following distance to:
questions.explanation: Motorcycles can stop quickly; increase distance to at least 4 seconds.

questions.questionText: A red octagon always means:
questions.explanation: The octagon shape is exclusively for Stop signs.

questions.questionText: How many points for passing a stopped school bus?
questions.explanation: Failing to stop for a school bus is a 3-point violation.

questions.questionText: If you are being tailgated:

answers.text: Move to the right lane and let them pass

questions.explanation: Allow tailgaters to pass by moving to the right.

questions.questionText: When exiting a private driveway:

answers.text: Yield to all traffic and pedestrians
You have the right of way

questions.explanation: Vehicles entering the road from a driveway must yield to all traffic and pedestrians.

questions.questionText: A yellow sign with a house and two people walking means:
questions.explanation: The pentagon shape with walkers indicates a School Zone.

questions.questionText: A driver under 21 with *any* bodily alcohol content receives ___ points.
questions.explanation: Zero Tolerance violation (under 21 with alcohol) is a 4-point offense.

questions.questionText: The most common reason for loss of control is:
questions.explanation: Excessive speed for road/weather conditions is the primary cause of crashes.
